name: PHP DOM HTML Parser
tagline: Similar with PHP Simple Dom library, faster, more effective.
body:
**PHP DOM HTML Parser** uses built-in [PHP DOM extension](http://php.net/manual/en/book.dom.php) to process your requests, after testing, it is 10x faster than [PHP Simple HTML DOM Parser](http://simplehtmldom.sourceforge.net/) PHP DOM extension requires the libxml PHP extension. This means that passing in --enable-libxml is also required, although this is implicitly accomplished because libxml is enabled by default. # Examples *** ## Getting Started ```php $html = '
test this library! PHP DOM HTML Parser
test string!
``` if you use Namespace ```php $html_dom = new \HtmlParser\ParserDom($html); ``` comment out the Namespace in line:2, if you don't use it ```php $html_dom = new ParserDom($html); ``` *** ## Basic usage Find all images ```php foreach($html_dom->find('img') as $element) { echo $element->src . '
'; echo $element->getAttr('src') . '
'; } ``` Find all links ```php foreach($html_dom->find('a') as $element) { echo $element->href . '
'; echo $element->getAttr('href') . '
'; } ``` Find all anchors, returns a array of element objects ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('a'); ``` Find (N)th anchor, returns element object or null if not found (zero based) ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('a', 0); ``` Find lastest anchor, returns element object or null if not found (zero based) ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('a', -1); ``` Find all `
` with the id attribute ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('div[id]'); ``` Find all `
` which attribute id=foo ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('div[id=foo]'); ``` ## Advanced usage Find all element which id=foo ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('#foo'); ``` Find all element which class=foo ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('.foo'); ``` Find all HTML tags with the id attribute ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('*[id]'); ``` Find all anchors and images ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('a, img'); ``` Find all anchors and images with the "title" attribute ```php $ret = $html_dom->find('a[title], img[title]'); ``` ## Descendant Seletors Find all `
  • ` in `
      ` ```php $es = $html_dom->find('ul li'); ``` Find Nested
      tags ```php $es = $html_dom->find('div div div'); ``` Find all `` in `` which class=hello ```php $es = $html_dom->find('table.hello td'); ``` Find all td tags with attribite align=center in table tags ```php $es = $html_dom->find('table td[align=center]'); ``` *** ## Modify HTML Modify class attribute ```php $html_dom->find('div', 1)->class = 'bar'; ``` Modify inner text (HTML is allowed) ```php $html_dom->find('div[id=hello]', 0)->innertext = 'foo'; ``` Modify outer HTML ```php // this is remove `` tag and replace with `

      ` tag $html_dom->find('a', 0)->outertext = '

      Title Link

      '; ``` *** ## Nested Seletors Find all `
    • ` in `
        ` ```php foreach($html_dom->find('ul') as $ul) { foreach($ul->find('li') as $li) { // do something... } } ``` Find first `
      • ` in first `
          ` ```php $e = $html_dom->find('ul', 0)->find('li', 0); ``` *** ## Attribute Selectors Filter | Description ------------------ [attribute] | Matches elements that have the specified attribute. [!attribute] | Matches elements that don't have the specified attribute. [attribute=value] | Matches elements that have the specified attribute with a certain value. [attribute!=value] | Matches elements that don't have the specified attribute with a certain value. [attribute^=value] | Matches elements that have the specified attribute and it starts with a certain value. [attribute$=value] | Matches elements that have the specified attribute and it ends with a certain value. [attribute*=value] | Matches elements that have the specified attribute and it contains a certain value. *** ## Magic Attribute ```php // Example HTML:
          foo bar
          $e = $html_dom->find("div", 0); echo $e->outertext; // Returns: "
          foo bar
          " echo $e->innertext; // Returns: "foo bar" echo $e->plaintext; // Returns: "foo bar" echo $e->class; // Returns: "blue-color" ``` Note: This library doesn't support $e->tag of PHP Simple Dom Attribute Name | Usage ------------------ $e->outertext | Read or write the outer HTML text of element. $e->innertext | Read or write the inner HTML text of element. $e->plaintext | Read or write the plain text of element. $e->src | Read "src" attribute of element. $e->class | Read "class" attribute of element. $e->href | Read "href" attribute of element. Except outertext, innertext and plaintext, you can use $e->attribute_name to read attribute of element. ## FAQ ### How to dump contents of DOM object? Dumps the internal DOM tree back into string ```php $str = $html_dom->save(); ``` Dumps the internal DOM tree back into a file ```php $html_dom->save('result.htm'); ```
